intro: Fridericia grosourdyana, commonly known as the Brazilian broom. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its slender, often sparsely branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in loose inflorescences. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Native to South America, it thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks.
